quest.name: Why They Call It the Blues
journal: Martyn is eager to take you into the field for further training.

Now that you have learned Mind Blast, Martyn deems you ready for the next stage in his impromptu training regime. Once again, Spineless Basin is the chosen location, recalling unwelcome memories of being duped into exterminating a pest to help line Martyn's pockets.

This time, the locals have paid Martyn in advance to slay some troublesome moles, a task which he has wasted no time in delegating to you. He insists that this will also prove beneficial in improving your blue magic, since they provide moving targets on which to test your new Mind Blast spell.

Despite being outnumbered, your burgeoning blue magic makes short work of the mischievous moles. Now that the pests have been dealt with, you hope that Martyn has something to teach you in exchange for your hard work.

You find Martyn being accosted by a gang of thugs, to whom he apparently owes money. Although your instincts as an adventurer compel you to rush to the aid of your mentor, he is adamant that he can handle these ruffians by himself. Rather than using his blue magic to repel his assailants, Martyn attempts to appease them by surrendering his clothes. His plan works better than expected, and the moneylenders decide not to carry out their threats of bodily harm, although the matter of the borrowed coin is far from settled. Not one to be deterred by such setbacks, Martyn heads back to Ul'dah, seemingly paying no heed to the fact that he is almost as naked as the day he was born.

Thankfully, Martyn found a spare costume awaiting him on his return, although having to pay for it himself only adds to his woes. The unexpected arrival of Whastrach, an old acquaintance, does nothing to brighten Martyn's mood. The unwelcome visitor's voice drips with disdain as he takes great relish in pointing out that the blue mage has become a shadow of his former self since leaving the Arcanists' Guild. And though Whastrach mercifully chooses not to stay any longer than necessary, it seems that Martyn will be seeing more of his former associate sooner rather than later. At a questioning look from you, your mentor reveals that they once worked as researchers and traveled to the New World to study blue magic. When their funding was cut, Martyn practically bankrupted himself to pursue his passion, while Whastrach chose a more lucrative career as the head of a trading company. Keen not to dwell on the past, Martyn changes the subject to more immediate matters, and sets you the task of learning the Faze spell as the next step to becoming a master of blue magic.

※The next blue mage quest will be available from Martyn upon reaching level 30 and learning Faze.
objectives: Rendezvous with Martyn at Spineless Basin in central Thanalan.
Survey the designated location and slay any monstrous moles that appear.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Any luck learnin' Mind Blast? ...Oh well, not to worry. It's not the easiest one to pick up, that's for sure. Let me know once you've mastered it, and I'll impart my next bit of wisdom.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next blue mage quest will be available from Martyn upon learning Mind Blast.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: So, you've learned Mind Blast already? That was quicker than I was expectin', but I'll take your word for it.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, your new spell might be useful in our next trainin' session. We're goin' back to Spineless Basin, so meet me there when you're ready.

dialogue.name: LATOOLJA
dialogue.text: Martyn is wearing mask more and more, even when no one can see him, and when is sleeping. Perhaps Martyn prefers being Great Azuro to being Martyn?

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Now, considerin' what happened last time, you might be thinkin' we came all the way here just to slay a few beasts for a handful of coin...

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: And you'd be exactly right! There are a few differences, though. Firstly, we've been paid in advance. Secondly, you'll be goin' up against moles, not hornets. And lastly, you have to kill two of them, not just one.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Why are you lookin' at me like that? Oh, you wanted trainin', didn't you? Erm...in that case, why not try stoppin' them in their tracks with Mind Blast? I tell you, it works wonders when you're outnumbered. Go on then, off you go! I ain't got all nightday!

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Don't forget, it's moles we're after and they spend a lot of time underground. You might have to do a bit of diggin' before they show themselves.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: That can't be right─I already gave you everythin' I owe!

dialogue.name: HIGHLANDER03195
dialogue.text: Yes, you paid back the original amount. Late, I might add. Very late. Don't tell me you'd forgotten about the interest?

dialogue.name: ROEGADYN03195
dialogue.text: Oi, you! This is none of your business! Piss off!

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Forename, I appreciate you tryin' to help, but I got myself into this mess, and I'll get myself out of it!

dialogue.name: LALAFELL03195
dialogue.text: You dress quite well for a penniless swindler! Not my size, but these fine garments should fetch a gil or two!

dialogue.name: HIGHLANDER03195
dialogue.text: Count yourself lucky─at least we left you enough cloth to protect your modesty. Make sure you've got our money next time, or we won't be so generous!

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Thank you! I'm eternally grateful!

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Ahem! Not my finest hour, I'll admit, but I've been through worse and lived to tell the tale!

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Speakin' of which, it looks like you survived your scuffle with those scary-lookin' moles! Let's head back to Ul'dah to celebrate.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Oh...that reminds me─Royse is bound to have some choice words for me about the costume. Well, I might've lost the shirt off my back, but at least I still have my dignity...

dialogue.name: LATOOLJA
dialogue.text: We know Martyn's favorite color, but we not know even his undergarments are blue. Latool Ja thinks it sign of dedication. Very admirable.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Royse was, as I expected, none too pleased when I showed up lookin' a bit...underdressed. Luckily, we had a spare outfit. Not so luckily, the cost is comin' out of my wages. <sigh> Things are goin' from bad to worse.

dialogue.name: WHASTRACH
dialogue.text: (-Condescending Voice-)My, my. This is certainly a far cry from your days at the Arcanists' Guild.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Whastrach? What're you doin' here?

dialogue.name: WHASTRACH
dialogue.text: If you must know, I'm here on business─very lucrative business, I might add. And as luck would have it, I heard rumors of the Masked Carnivale, starring a so-called blue mage. It didn't take much to deduce that my old friend Martyn was behind it.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: If you're here to watch the show, buy a ticket. If you just came to gloat, save it for another time, because I ain't in the bloody mood.

dialogue.name: WHASTRACH
dialogue.text: I say! It's not like you to be so hostile. Perhaps I should come back when you're feeling a little more amenable. I'll be seeing you, Martyn.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: The less I see of that smug prick, the better. You see, we've known each other since our time at the Arcanists' Guild, where we researched magicks from outside of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: We both traveled to the New World and spent time with the Whalaqee, who taught us about blue magic. But when we came back to the guild to share our findin's, they said it was “simply not practical” and cut off our fundin'.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: The theory was sound, I just needed to spend more time with the Whalaqee, so I paid for another expedition out of my own pocket. Damn near ruined me, though. Now I'm up to my neck in debt, tryin' to make ends meet by performin' like some bloody clown!

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Whastrach, on the other hand, ditched the research when he realized there was no money in it. Even though he went through all the trouble of learnin' blue magic like me, he just lost interest.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: After that, he came back to Eorzea and set up his own tradin' company. Him and his rich friends started rakin' in the gil, doin' gods only know what.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Sorry, Forename. I expect you've got better things to do than listen to my sob stories. Like learnin' some more spells, for instance!

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: The next one I want you to add to your arsenal is “Faze.” It's perfect for givin' you an openin' to land a few more hits. Or run away─whichever you prefer.

dialogue.name: MARTYN
dialogue.text: Anyway, once you've mastered that one, come and see me. Becomin' a blue mage ain't easy─and I know that better than most─but stick with it, and one day you'll be just like me! Actually, you should probably ignore that last part...
